ns1:DomainModel.projectDescription: Function Express Server is a tool that will annotate probes on microarrays using publicly available biomedical databases and will automatically update these annotations on a regular basis. This data can be viewed using a web-based query interface or may be accessed programmatically using the provided Application Programmers Interface (API). Function Express Server can be used to create and populate a database that will store interrelated gene annotation data. The web pages allow the user to display a gene literature network in a tabular format, to search for genes on various annotations like Entrez Gene, UniGene, Gene Ontology term, etc.

ns1:UMLClass.description: General term for a piece of DNA or RNA corresponding to a gene or sequence of interest, that has been labelled either radioactively or with some other detectable molecule, such as biotin, digoxygenin or fluorescein.

ns2:UMLAttribute.description: The description for a Probeset associated with a MicroArray
ns2:UMLAttribute.name: description

ns2:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: Description; a statement that represents something in words.
The words or language units by which a thing is known.

ns2:UMLAttribute.description: A Primary Key to uniquely identify a Probeset Object
ns2:UMLAttribute.name: id

ns2:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.

ns3:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: A group of things of the same kind that belong together and are so used.

ns4:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: General term for a piece of DNA or RNA corresponding to a gene or sequence of interest, that has been labelled either radioactively or with some other detectable molecule, such as biotin, digoxygenin or fluorescein. As stretches of DNA or RNA with complementary sequences will (hybridize), a probe will label viral plaques, bacterial colonies or bands on a gel that contain the gene of interest. (On-line Medical Dictionary)

ns1:UMLClass.description: The version history for gene object

ns5:UMLAttribute.description: The version of the Unigene data source
ns5:UMLAttribute.name: unigeneVersion

ns5:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: Version; something a little different from others of the same type; one of a sequence of copies of a program, each incorporating new modifications.

UniGene is an experimental system for automatically partitioning GenBank sequences into a non-redundant set of gene-oriented clusters. Each UniGene cluster contains sequences that represent a unique gene, as well as related information such as the tissue types in which the gene has been expressed and map location. It is provided as a web application from the National Center for Biotechnology Information (NCBI).

ns5:UMLAttribute.description: The version of db SNP data source
ns5:UMLAttribute.name: dbSNPVersion

ns5:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: The Single Nucleotide Polymorphism database (dbSNP) is a database repository and internet resource for a broad collection of simple genetic polymorphisms. It is hosted by the National Center for Biotechnology Information.
Version; something a little different from others of the same type; one of a sequence of copies of a program, each incorporating new modifications.

ns5:UMLAttribute.description: The version of the Taxonomy data source
ns5:UMLAttribute.name: taxonomyVersion

ns5:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: Version; something a little different from others of the same type; one of a sequence of copies of a program, each incorporating new modifications.
The theories and techniques of naming, describing, and classifying organisms, and the study of the relationships of taxa. (from On-line Medical Dictionary)

ns5:UMLAttribute.description: The version of the Homologene data source
ns5:UMLAttribute.name: homologeneVersion

ns5:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: A system provided by the National Center for Biotechnology Information for automated detection of homologs among the annotated genes of several completely sequenced eukaryotic genomes.
Version; something a little different from others of the same type; one of a sequence of copies of a program, each incorporating new modifications.

ns5:UMLAttribute.description: The version of the Gene Ontology data source
ns5:UMLAttribute.name: goVersion

ns5:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: Version; something a little different from others of the same type; one of a sequence of copies of a program, each incorporating new modifications.

The Gene Ontology (GO) project is a collaborative effort to address the need for consistent descriptions of gene products in different databases. The goal of the Gene Ontology project is to produce a controlled vocabulary that can be applied to all organisms even as knowledge of gene and protein roles in cells is accumulating and changing. GO provides three structured networks of defined terms, molecular function, biological process, and cellular component, to describe gene product attributes. (from http://www.geneontology.org/)

ns5:UMLAttribute.description: The version of the Entrez data source
ns5:UMLAttribute.name: entrezgeneVersion

ns5:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: Version; something a little different from others of the same type; one of a sequence of copies of a program, each incorporating new modifications.

Entrez Gene is NCBI's database for gene-specific information. It focuses on the genomes that have been completely sequenced, that have an active research community to contribute gene-specific information, or that are scheduled for intense sequence analysi

ns5:UMLAttribute.description: A unique identifier for a GeneVersion. This should to map to the Primary Key in the associated table
ns5:UMLAttribute.name: id

ns5:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.

ns5:UMLAttribute.description: The version of the Pubmed data source
ns5:UMLAttribute.name: pubmedVersion

ns5:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: PubMed is a web application from the National Library of Medicine (NLM). It provides a single query interface to over 15 million citations for biomedical articles back to the 1950's. These citations are from MEDLINE and additional life science journals. PubMed includes links to many sites providing full text articles and other related resources.
Version; something a little different from others of the same type; one of a sequence of copies of a program, each incorporating new modifications.

ns5:UMLAttribute.description: The version of the uniSTS data source
ns5:UMLAttribute.name: uniSTSVersion

ns5:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: A comprehensive database of sequence tagged sites (STSs) derived from STS-based maps and other experiments providing a unified, non-redundant view of sequence tagged sites. UniSTS integrates marker and mapping data from a variety of public resources.
Version; something a little different from others of the same type; one of a sequence of copies of a program, each incorporating new modifications.

ns6:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: A functional unit of heredity which occupies a specific position (locus) on a particular chromosome, is capable of reproducing itself exactly at each cell division, and directs the formation of an enzyme or other protein. The gene as a functional unit consists of a discrete segment of a giant DNA molecule containing the purine (adenine and guanine) and pyrimidine (cytosine and thymine) bases in the ordered and correct sequence that encodes a specific functional product (i.e., a protein or RNA molecule).

ns7:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: Version; something a little different from others of the same type; one of a sequence of copies of a program, each incorporating new modifications.

ns1:UMLClass.description: Sequence Tagged Site obtained for the associated gene from NCBI's Entrezgene Datasource

ns8:UMLAttribute.description: Unique identifier for Sequence Tagged Site obtained from NCBI's Entrezgene DataSource
ns8:UMLAttribute.name: id

ns8:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.

ns9:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: Short (200 to 500 base pairs) DNA sequence that is operationally unique and has a single occurrence in the human genome and whose location and base sequence are known and therefore they can be used as landmarks in genome mapping.

ns1:UMLClass.description: An object that contains the computed correlation values between the gene represented by this objects and the associated Gene object.

ns10:UMLAttribute.description: Unique identifier for this object. This would map to the Primary Key for this Object in the Database
ns10:UMLAttribute.name: id

ns10:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.

ns10:UMLAttribute.description: The Identifier for a Gene from the ENTREZGENE public data source. This is the gene with which correlation is computed with the associated Gene
ns10:UMLAttribute.name: toGene

ns10:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: A functional unit of heredity which occupies a specific position (locus) on a particular chromosome, is capable of reproducing itself exactly at each cell division, and directs the formation of an enzyme or other protein. The gene as a functional unit consists of a discrete segment of a giant DNA molecule containing the purine (adenine and guanine) and pyrimidine (cytosine and thymine) bases in the ordered and correct sequence that encodes a specific functional product (i.e., a protein or RNA molecule).

ns10:UMLAttribute.description: correlation value between the gene represente by this object and the associated gene
ns10:UMLAttribute.name: correlation

ns10:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: The degree to which two or more quantities or events are linearly associated, a statistical relation between two or more variables such that systematic changes in the value of one variable are accompanied by systematic changes in the others.

ns12:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: A class of publication in which original scientific work is described. The format usually includes an introduction in which relevant concepts are identified and the experimental system under study is presented, a section describing the experiments that were performed to test a specific hypothesis and the results and observations that were obtained, a section in which the results are discussed relative to findings by other investigators and the current state of knowledge in the field, and a section describing the experimental methods and procedures in sufficient detail to enable the reproduction of the work by independent investigators.

ns1:UMLClass.description: Represents the NCBI's Online Mendelian Inheritance in Man Database

ns13:UMLAttribute.description: Represents the Online Mendelian Inheritance in Man identifier for the associated gene which is in the Entrezgene database
ns13:UMLAttribute.name: id

ns13:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.

ns14:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: This database is a catalog of human genes and genetic disorders authored and edited by Dr. Victor A. McKusick and his colleagues at Johns Hopkins and elsewhere, and developed for the World Wide Web by NCBI, the National Center for Biotechnology Information. The database contains textual information and references. It also contains copious links to MEDLINE and sequence records in the Entrez system, and links to additional related resources at NCBI and elsewhere. (http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/entrez/query.fcgi?db=OMIM)

ns1:UMLClass.description: Represents the Tissue sources in which the associated Gene is expressed. Essentially this represents the tissue sources from where the cDNAs are syntheised/extracted and obtained from the UniGene DataSource.

ns15:UMLAttribute.description: Represents the Tissues and Development stages where the associated gene is expressed.
ns15:UMLAttribute.name: name

ns15:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: The words or language units by which a thing is known.

ns15:UMLAttribute.description: A unique identifier for the UnigeneTissueSource Object. This would map to the Primary Key Column
ns15:UMLAttribute.name: id

ns15:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.

ns17:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: is an organ part that consists of similarly specialized cells and intercellular matrix, aggregated according to specific spatial relationships; together with other tissues, it constitutes an organ component. Example(s): epithelium, muscle(tissue), connective tissue, neural tissue, lymphoid tissue.

ns18:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: UniGene is an experimental system for automatically partitioning GenBank sequences into a non-redundant set of gene-oriented clusters. Each UniGene cluster contains sequences that represent a unique gene, as well as related information such as the tissue types in which the gene has been expressed and map location. It is provided as a web application from the National Center for Biotechnology Information (NCBI).

ns1:UMLClass.description: A microarray is a piece of glass or plastic on which different samples have been affixed at separate locations in an ordered manner thus forming a microscopic array.

ns19:UMLAttribute.description: A unique identifier for the MicroArray Object. This would map to the Primary Key Column
ns19:UMLAttribute.name: id

ns19:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.
The words or language units by which a thing is known.

ns20:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: A microarray is a piece of glass or plastic on which different samples have been affixed at separate locations in an ordered manner thus forming a microscopic array. The samples are usually DNA fragments but may also be antibodies, other proteins, or tissues.

ns1:UMLClass.description: Represents a Phenotype for a gene from NCBI's Entrezgene Datasource

ns21:UMLAttribute.description: The description of phenotype for the associated gene object obtained from Entrezgene Datasource
ns21:UMLAttribute.name: description

ns21:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: Description; a statement that represents something in words.

ns21:UMLAttribute.description: A unique identifier for the Phenotype Object. This would map to the Primary key column in the Database.
ns21:UMLAttribute.name: id

ns21:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.

ns22:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: The outward appearance of the individual. It is the product of interactions between genes and between the genotype and the environment. This includes the killer phenotype, characteristic of YEASTS.

ns1:UMLClass.description: Gene details object to provide all the identifiers of a gene from the EntrezGene Database

ns23:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: A unique gene name approved by an organism specific nomenclature committee.

ns23:UMLAttribute.description: The Identifier for a Gene from the ENTREZGENE public data source
ns23:UMLAttribute.name: id

ns23:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: One or more characters and/or numbers that are used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of genomic sequences, mRNA transcripts, protein products, or other class of entities that occurs throughout the genome.

Entrez Gene is NCBI's database for gene-specific information. It focuses on the genomes that have been completely sequenced, that have an active research community to contribute gene-specific information, or that are scheduled for intense sequence analysi

ns23:UMLAttribute.description: A name for a gene determined by the Entrez Gene project at NCBI.
ns23:UMLAttribute.name: name

ns23:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: The words or language units by which a thing is known.

One of the bodies (normally 46 in humans) in the cell nucleus that is the bearer of genes, has the form of a delicate chromatin filament during interphase, contracts to form a compact cylinder segmented into two arms by the centromere during metaphase and anaphase stages of cell division, and is capable of reproducing its physical and chemical structure through successive cell divisions. In microbes, the chromosome is prokaryotic, not being enclosed within a nuclear membrane and not being subject to a mitotic mechanism.
Physical map location of a Gene, expressed as either a cytological chromosomal band or by chromosome, start point and end point

ns23:UMLAttribute.description: Summray of the gene provided by NCBI's Entrez gene data source
ns23:UMLAttribute.name: summary

ns23:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: A shortened version of a speech or written text, containing only the main points; a summary.

ns23:UMLAttribute.description: The number of Pubmed Ids associated with the genes
ns23:UMLAttribute.name: pubmedCount

ns23:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: To determine the number or amount of something; the result of this activity.

PubMed is a web application from the National Library of Medicine (NLM). It provides a single query interface to over 15 million citations for biomedical articles back to the 1950's. These citations are from MEDLINE and additional life science journals. PubMed includes links to many sites providing full text articles and other related resources.

ns24:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: A functional unit of heredity which occupies a specific position (locus) on a particular chromosome, is capable of reproducing itself exactly at each cell division, and directs the formation of an enzyme or other protein. The gene as a functional unit consists of a discrete segment of a giant DNA molecule containing the purine (adenine and guanine) and pyrimidine (cytosine and thymine) bases in the ordered and correct sequence that encodes a specific functional product (i.e., a protein or RNA molecule).

ns25:UMLAttribute.name: clusterId

ns25:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: One or more characters and/or numbers that are used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of genomic sequences, mRNA transcripts, protein products, or other class of entities that occurs throughout the genome.

ns25:UMLAttribute.name: id

ns25:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.

ns26:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: UniGene is an experimental system for automatically partitioning GenBank sequences into a non-redundant set of gene-oriented clusters. Each UniGene cluster contains sequences that represent a unique gene, as well as related information such as the tissue types in which the gene has been expressed and map location. It is provided as a web application from the National Center for Biotechnology Information (NCBI).

ns1:UMLClass.description: This represents the orthologus gene to the associated gene. These are obtained from the NCBI's Homologene datasource.

ns27:UMLAttribute.description: An identifier to uniquely identify the OrthologusGene Object. This would map to the Primary key for Orthrologus Gene Object in the Database
ns27:UMLAttribute.name: id

ns27:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.

ns27:UMLAttribute.description: The entrezGene Id of this homologue
ns27:UMLAttribute.name: entrezGeneId

ns27:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: One or more characters and/or numbers that are used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of genomic sequences, mRNA transcripts, protein products, or other class of entities that occurs throughout the genome.

Entrez Gene is NCBI's database for gene-specific information. It focuses on the genomes that have been completely sequenced, that have an active research community to contribute gene-specific information, or that are scheduled for intense sequence analysi

ns27:UMLAttribute.description: Represents a reciprocal best match between this homologue and the associated gene
ns27:UMLAttribute.name: isReciprocal

ns27:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: Occurring in one species but corresponding to one in another species that is related via a common ancestral species

ns27:UMLAttribute.description: Represents the mapping of one DNA sequence onto another evolutionarily related DNA sequence in order to identify regions that have been conserved.
ns27:UMLAttribute.name: alignment

ns27:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: The act of adjusting or aligning objects in relation to each other; the result of this activity.

ns28:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: A gene from one species which corresponds to a gene in another species that is related via a common ancestral species (a homologous gene), but which has evolved to become different from the gene of the other species. (http://biotech.icmb.utexas.edu)

ns1:UMLClass.description: A living thing, such as an animal, a plant, a bacterium, or a fungus.

ns29:UMLAttribute.description: The NCBI's taxonomy Identifier is a stable unique identifier for each taxon
ns29:UMLAttribute.name: ncbiTaxonomyID

ns29:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: Established in 1988 as a national resource for molecular biology information, NCBI creates public databases, conducts research in computational biology, develops software tools for analyzing genome data, and disseminates biomedical information - all for the better understanding of molecular processes affecting human health and disease. (http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/)
One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.
The theories and techniques of naming, describing, and classifying organisms, and the study of the relationships of taxa. (from On-line Medical Dictionary)

ns29:UMLAttribute.description: The name applied to a plant, animal, or other organism, according to the Codes of Nomenclature, consisting of a Genus and species. Essentiallly represents the Scientific Name of an Organism
ns29:UMLAttribute.name: name

ns29:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: The name applied to a plant, animal, or other organism, according to the Codes of Nomenclature, consisting of a Genus and species.

ns29:UMLAttribute.description: A unique identifier for the Organism Object. This would map to the Primary Key for Organism table in the Database
ns29:UMLAttribute.name: id

ns29:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.

ns30:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: A living thing, such as an animal, a plant, a bacterium, or a fungus.

ns1:UMLClass.description: Represets the Gene Ontology associated with the given gene from the Entrezgene database

ns31:UMLAttribute.description: The name for the specific goObject
ns31:UMLAttribute.name: term

ns31:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: A word or expression used for some particular thing.

ns31:UMLAttribute.description: This uniquely identifies the Gene Ontology object
ns31:UMLAttribute.name: id

ns31:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.

ns32:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: The Gene Ontology (GO) project is a collaborative effort to address the need for consistent descriptions of gene products in different databases. The goal of the Gene Ontology project is to produce a controlled vocabulary that can be applied to all organisms even as knowledge of gene and protein roles in cells is accumulating and changing. GO provides three structured networks of defined terms, molecular function, biological process, and cellular component, to describe gene product attributes. (from http://www.geneontology.org/)

ns1:UMLClass.description: The GenBank Accession for a Gene

ns33:UMLAttribute.description: One or more characters and/or numbers that are used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of genomic sequences, mRNA transcripts, protein products, or other class of entities that occurs throughout the genome
ns33:UMLAttribute.name: number

ns33:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: One or more characters and/or numbers that are used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of genomic sequences, mRNA transcripts, protein products, or other class of entities that occurs throughout the genome.
Indicates the accession number for a Gene within the GenBank database.

ns33:UMLAttribute.description: A uniuque identifier for the GenBankAccession Object. This will map to the Primary Key column in the Database
ns33:UMLAttribute.name: id

ns33:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.

ns34:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: A control number unique to an object, used to identify it among the other objects in a collection.

ns35:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: The NIH genetic sequence database, an annotated collection of all publicly available DNA sequences. GenBank records are annotated using a standard set of biological terms and show these annotations in a Feature Table.

ns1:UMLClass.description: Single Nucleotide Polymorphism data obtained from NCBI's dbSNP datasource

ns36:UMLAttribute.description: Unique identifier for Ref Single Nucleotide Polymorphism obtained from NCBI's dbSNP datasource
ns36:UMLAttribute.name: id

ns36:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.

ns37:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: A variation of a single nucleotide at a specific location of the genome due to base substitution, present at an appreciable frequency between individuals of a single interbreeding population.

ns1:UMLClass.description: A chromosome is, minimally, a very long, continuous piece of DNA, which contains many genes, regulatory elements and other intervening nucleotide sequences.

ns38:UMLAttribute.description: A unique identifier for the Chromosome Object. This maps to the Primary Key for the Chromosome object in the Database
ns38:UMLAttribute.name: id

ns38:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.

ns38:UMLAttribute.description: The numeric or letter designation of a chromosome obtained from NCBI's Entrezgene datasource. Autosomes are usually indicated by numbers and sex chromosomes by letters.
ns38:UMLAttribute.name: name

ns38:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: The words or language units by which a thing is known.

ns39:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: One of the bodies (normally 46 in humans) in the cell nucleus that is the bearer of genes, has the form of a delicate chromatin filament during interphase, contracts to form a compact cylinder segmented into two arms by the centromere during metaphase and anaphase stages of cell division, and is capable of reproducing its physical and chemical structure through successive cell divisions. In microbes, the chromosome is prokaryotic, not being enclosed within a nuclear membrane and not being subject to a mitotic mechanism.
